JobFullDesc: At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, fresh thinking and possibilities are forged in times of change and you will be on the front lines as we trailblaze new approaches, push the boundaries of innovation and chart a course to a tomorrow you can be proud to have a hand in creating.Industrial Engineers apply advanced problem solving techniques and lean principles to develop and optimize the Manufacturing system in order to maximize throughput, increase efficiency and value. Industrial Engineers are involved in all phases of the factory life cycle, including proposals, Capacity Planning, Manpower Planning, Factory Layout, Cell/Line balancing, Simulation and Process Modeling, Labor Performance Analysis, Pareto Analysis, Process Mapping, and Project Management.Responsibilities to Anticipate: Identify throughput constraints by performing capacity, simulation, what-if scenario analysis.Drive factory improvement project priorities through the use of analytical tools.Coordinate factory capability needs for yield improvements and new technology.Support/Lead factory development through project justification, design and implementation.Identify and participate in improvement projects to support constraint elimination.Identify and participate in Safety and Ergonomic improvements.Apply Six Sigma and Lean Principles to include the use of value stream maps, line balancing, and error proofing. Support manufacturing objectives for cost, quality, on time delivery and safety.Support the 5-Year Strategic Roadmap development and maintenance.Develop strategic plan for factory space, manpower, equipment and automation.Coordinate factory and process life-cycle optimization.Support bids, proposals, and Make/Buy/Where analysis.An advanced degree in a related field may be substituted for 2 additional years of experience.A PhD can account for 5 years of experience as required for this position.Qualifications You Must Have:Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Engineering, Systems Engineering or related STEM field and 5 years of relevant experience Experience applying Lean Manufacturing Principles (Process Improvement and methods optimization)The ability to obtain and maintain an Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives Access (ATF)Ability to obtain and maintain a US security clearance prior to the start date. U.S. citizenship is required as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearanceQualifications We Value:Experience/Education with Simulation Modeling, Constraint AnalysisExperience/Education with factory design and workcell optimizationExperience/Education with project managementExperience/Education with discrete event simulationExperience/Education with CAD softwareSix Sigma CertificationManufacturing process control and performance analysisSix Sigma principlesSimulation modelingLean principlesStatistical Quality ControlExcellent interpersonal and communication skillsActive DOD Security ClearanceWhat We Offer:Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the superior benefits we offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care.Clearance Information: This position requires the eligibility to obtain a security clearance. More information about Security Clearances can be found on the US Department of State government website here: https://www.state.gov/m/ds/clearances/c10978.htm This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.
